articles.title: Inline code nodes now supported in Amazon Bedrock Flows in public preview
articles.description: We are excited to announce the public preview of support for inline code nodes in Amazon Bedrock Flows. With this powerful new capability, you can write Python scripts directly within your workflow, alleviating the need for separate AWS Lambda functions for simple logic. This feature streamlines preprocessing and postprocessing tasks (like data normalization and response formatting), simplifying generative AI application development and making it more accessible across organizations.
articles.author: Shubhankar Sumar
articles.content: We are excited to announce the public preview of support for inline code nodes in Amazon Bedrock Flows. With this powerful new capability, you can write Python scripts directly within your workflow, alleviating the need for separate AWS Lambda functions for simple logic. This feature streamlines preprocessing and postprocessing tasks (like data normalization and response formatting), simplifying generative AI application development and making it more accessible across organizations.

articles.title: A Practical Guide to Handling Out-of-Memory Data in Python
articles.description: These days, it is not uncommon to come across datasets that are too large to fit into random access memory (RAM), especially when working on advanced data analysis projects at scale, managing streaming data generated at high velocity, or building large machine learning models.
articles.author: Iván Palomares Carrascosa
articles.content: These days, it is not uncommon to come across datasets that are too large to fit into random access memory (RAM), especially when working on advanced data analysis projects at scale, managing streaming data generated at high velocity, or building large machine learning models.

articles.title: Why tiny bee brains could hold the key to smarter AI
articles.description: Researchers discovered that bees use flight movements to sharpen brain signals, enabling them to recognize patterns with remarkable accuracy. A digital model of their brain shows that this movement-based perception could revolutionize AI and robotics by emphasizing efficiency over massive computing power.
articles.content: Researchers discovered that bees use flight movements to sharpen brain signals, enabling them to recognize patterns with remarkable accuracy. A digital model of their brain shows that this movement-based perception could revolutionize AI and robotics by emphasizing efficiency over massive computing power.

articles.title: ArgRAG: Explainable Retrieval Augmented Generation using Quantitative Bipolar Argumentation
articles.description: arXiv:2508.20131v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) enhances large language models by incorporating external knowledge, yet suffers from critical limitations in high-stakes domains -- namely, sensitivity to noisy or contradictory evidence and opaque, stochastic decision-making. We propose ArgRAG, an explainable, and contestable alternative that replaces black-box reasoning with structured inference using a Quantitative Bipolar Argumentation Framework (QBAF)....
articles.author: Yuqicheng Zhu, Nico Potyka, Daniel Hern\'andez, Yuan He, Zifeng Ding, Bo Xiong, Dongzhuoran Zhou, Evgeny Kharlamov, Steffen Staab
articles.content: arXiv:2508.20131v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) enhances large language models by incorporating external knowledge, yet suffers from critical limitations in high-stakes domains -- namely, sensitivity to noisy or contradictory evidence and opaque, stochastic decision-making. We propose ArgRAG, an explainable, and contestable alternative that replaces black-box reasoning with structured inference using a Quantitative Bipolar Argumentation Framework (QBAF)....

articles.title: Empowering air quality research with secure, ML-driven predictive analytics
articles.description: In this post, we provide a data imputation solution using Amazon SageMaker AI, AWS Lambda, and AWS Step Functions. This solution is designed for environmental analysts, public health officials, and business intelligence professionals who need reliable PM2.5 data for trend analysis, reporting, and decision-making. We sourced our sample training dataset from openAFRICA. Our solution predicts PM2.5 values using time-series forecasting.
articles.author: Nehal Sangoi
articles.content: In this post, we provide a data imputation solution using Amazon SageMaker AI, AWS Lambda, and AWS Step Functions. This solution is designed for environmental analysts, public health officials, and business intelligence professionals who need reliable PM2.5 data for trend analysis, reporting, and decision-making. We sourced our sample training dataset from openAFRICA. Our solution predicts PM2.5 values using time-series forecasting.

articles.title: RIKEN, Japan’s Leading Science Institute, Taps Fujitsu and NVIDIA for Next Flagship Supercomputer
articles.description: Japan is once again building a landmark high-performance computing system — not simply by chasing speed, but by rethinking how technology can best serve the nation’s most urgent scientific needs. At the FugakuNEXT International Initiative Launch Ceremony held in Tokyo on Aug. 22, leaders from RIKEN, Japan’s top research institute, announced the start of an Read Article

articles.title: OpenAI's GPT-5 Now Generally Available on Microsoft Azure AI Foundry
articles.description: Microsoft and OpenAI launched GPT-5 on the Azure AI Foundry, revolutionizing enterprise AI with its advanced reasoning and task-specific model orchestration. This suite enhances applications like Microsoft 365 Copilot and GitHub Copilot, enabling seamless interactions and high-quality outputs tailored for real-world scenarios. GPT-5 empowers organizations to drive AI transformation efficiently. By Steef-Jan Wiggers
articles.author: Steef-Jan Wiggers
articles.content: Microsoft and OpenAI launched GPT-5 on the Azure AI Foundry, revolutionizing enterprise AI with its advanced reasoning and task-specific model orchestration. This suite enhances applications like Microsoft 365 Copilot and GitHub Copilot, enabling seamless interactions and high-quality outputs tailored for real-world scenarios. GPT-5 empowers organizations to drive AI transformation efficiently. By Steef-Jan Wiggers

articles.title: JVM essentials for Elasticsearch: Metrics, memory, and monitoring
articles.description: Elasticsearch is a Java-based search and analytics engine and vector database built on Apache Lucene, and it is the core of Elastic’s Search AI Platform. To run Elasticsearch on its supported platforms, you need a Java virtual machine (JVM). JVM provides a platform-independent runtime environment, and you can run Elasticsearch in a virtual environment on top of the existing operating system. The JVM abstracts the underlying OS and hardware, so Java applications can run on any...
articles.author: Nitish Pandey
articles.content: Elasticsearch is a Java-based search and analytics engine and vector database built on Apache Lucene, and it is the core of Elastic’s Search AI Platform. articles.title: Generalizable AI Model for Indoor Temperature Forecasting Across Sub-Saharan Africa
articles.description: arXiv:2508.20260v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study presents a lightweight, domain-informed AI model for predicting indoor temperatures in naturally ventilated schools and homes in Sub-Saharan Africa. The model extends the Temp-AI-Estimator framework, trained on Tanzanian school data, and evaluated on Nigerian schools and Gambian homes. It achieves robust cross-country performance using only minimal accessible inputs, with mean absolute errors of 1.45{\deg}C for Nigerian schools and...
articles.author: Zainab Akhtar, Eunice Jengo, Bj\"orn Ha{\ss}ler
articles.content: arXiv:2508.20260v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study presents a lightweight, domain-informed AI model for predicting indoor temperatures in naturally ventilated schools and homes in Sub-Saharan Africa. The model extends the Temp-AI-Estimator framework, trained on Tanzanian school data, and evaluated on Nigerian schools and Gambian homes. It achieves robust cross-country performance using only minimal accessible inputs, with mean absolute errors of 1.45{\deg}C for Nigerian schools and...

articles.title: Grounding Multimodal Large Language Models with Quantitative Skin Attributes: A Retrieval Study
articles.description: arXiv:2508.20188v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artificial Intelligence models have demonstrated significant success in diagnosing skin diseases, including cancer, showing the potential to assist clinicians in their analysis. However, the interpretability of model predictions must be significantly improved before they can be used in practice. To this end, we explore the combination of two promising approaches: Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) and quantitative attribute usage. MLLMs...
articles.author: Max Torop, Masih Eskandar, Nicholas Kurtansky, Jinyang Liu, Jochen Weber, Octavia Camps, Veronica Rotemberg, Jennifer Dy, Kivanc Kose

To this end, we explore the combination of two promising approaches: Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) and quantitative attribute usage. MLLMs...

articles.title: Provable Benefits of In-Tool Learning for Large Language Models
articles.description: arXiv:2508.20755v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Tool-augmented language models, equipped with retrieval, memory, or external APIs, are reshaping AI, yet their theoretical advantages remain underexplored. In this paper, we address this question by demonstrating the benefits of in-tool learning (external retrieval) over in-weight learning (memorization) for factual recall. We show that the number of facts a model can memorize solely in its weights is fundamentally limited by its parameter...
articles.author: Sam Houliston, Ambroise Odonnat, Charles Arnal, Vivien Cabannes
articles.content: arXiv:2508.20755v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Tool-augmented language models, equipped with retrieval, memory, or external APIs, are reshaping AI, yet their theoretical advantages remain underexplored. In this paper, we address this question by demonstrating the benefits of in-tool learning (external retrieval) over in-weight learning (memorization) for factual recall. articles.title: The Role of Teacher Calibration in Knowledge Distillation
articles.description: arXiv:2508.20224v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Knowledge Distillation (KD) has emerged as an effective model compression technique in deep learning, enabling the transfer of knowledge from a large teacher model to a compact student model. While KD has demonstrated significant success, it is not yet fully understood which factors contribute to improving the student's performance. In this paper, we reveal a strong correlation between the teacher's calibration error and the student's accuracy....
articles.author: Suyoung Kim, Seonguk Park, Junhoo Lee, Nojun Kwak
articles.content: arXiv:2508.20224v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Knowledge Distillation (KD) has emerged as an effective model compression technique in deep learning, enabling the transfer of knowledge from a large teacher model to a compact student model. While KD has demonstrated significant success, it is not yet fully understood which factors contribute to improving the student's performance. In this paper, we reveal a strong correlation between the teacher's calibration error and the student's accuracy....

articles.title: Discovering equations from data: symbolic regression in dynamical systems
articles.description: arXiv:2508.20257v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The process of discovering equations from data lies at the heart of physics and in many other areas of research, including mathematical ecology and epidemiology. Recently, machine learning methods known as symbolic regression have automated this process. As several methods are available in the literature, it is important to compare them, particularly for dynamic systems that describe complex phenomena. In this paper, five symbolic regression...
articles.author: Beatriz R. Brum, Luiza Lober, Isolde Previdelli, Francisco A. Rodrigues

As several methods are available in the literature, it is important to compare them, particularly for dynamic systems that describe complex phenomena. In this paper, five symbolic regression...

articles.title: A Metropolis-Adjusted Langevin Algorithm for Sampling Jeffreys Prior
articles.description: arXiv:2504.06372v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Inference and estimation are fundamental in statistics, system identification, and machine learning. When prior knowledge about the system is available, Bayesian analysis provides a natural framework for encoding it through a prior distribution. In practice, such knowledge is often too vague to specify a full prior distribution, motivating the use of default 'uninformative' priors that minimize subjective bias. Jeffreys prior is an...
articles.author: Yibo Shi, Braghadeesh Lakshminarayanan, Cristian R. Rojas
articles.content: arXiv:2504.06372v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Inference and estimation are fundamental in statistics, system identification, and machine learning. In practice, such knowledge is often too vague to specify a full prior distribution, motivating the use of default 'uninformative' priors that minimize subjective bias. Jeffreys prior is an...

articles.title: IntentionReasoner: Facilitating Adaptive LLM Safeguards through Intent Reasoning and Selective Query Refinement
articles.description: arXiv:2508.20151v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) has driven their adoption across diverse domains, yet their ability to generate harmful content poses significant safety challenges. While extensive research has focused on mitigating harmful outputs, such efforts often come at the cost of excessively rejecting harmless prompts. Striking a balance among safety, over-refusal, and utility remains a critical challenge. In this work, we introduce...
articles.author: Yuanzhe Shen, Zisu Huang, Zhengkang Guo, Yide Liu, Guanxu Chen, Ruicheng Yin, Xiaoqing Zheng, Xuanjing Huang
